body_html: @ahundt I think this could have more to do more with your gcc than bazel. IE, it seems as if you run gcc -march=native -Q and it promises to turn on -mavx flag for -march=native, but then it doesn't. Maybe you could validate it by building something else with gcc directly and seeing if problem persists?
body_text: @ahundt I think this could have more to do more with your gcc than bazel. IE, it seems as if you run gcc -march=native -Q and it promises to turn on -mavx flag for -march=native, but then it doesn't. Maybe you could validate it by building something else with gcc directly and seeing if problem persists?
body: @ahundt I think this could have more to do more with your gcc than bazel. IE, it seems as if you run `gcc -march=native -Q` and it promises to turn on `-mavx` flag for `-march=native`, but then it doesn't. Maybe you could validate it by building something else with `gcc` directly and seeing if problem persists?
